text: Stephen Ira Miran is an American economist and politician who has been the 32nd Chair of the Council of Economic Advisers. He is a senior strategist at Hudson Bay Capital Management. In December 2024, President-elect Donald Trump named Miran as his nominee for Chairman of the Council of Economic Advisers. He was confirmed by the U.S. Senate in March 2025. ==Early life== Miran graduated from Boston University in 2005. He studied economics, philosophy, and mathematics. He received a PhD in economics from Harvard University in 2010. He was a student of Martin Feldstein. ==Career== Miran was an advisor of economic policy for the Department of the Treasury from 2020 to 2021. Miran is a senior strategist at Hudson Bay Capital Management. He was a co-founder of the asset management firm Amberwave Partners. He was also an adjunct fellow at the Manhattan Institute. ==Chair of the Council of Economic Advisers== On December 22, 2024, President-elect Donald Trump picked Miran as his nominee for chairman of the Council of Economic Advisers. He was confirmed by the Senate for the office on March 12, 2025. He was confirmed in a 53-46 vote. ==References== Category:Living people Category:American economists Category:Politicians from New York City Category:Businesspeople from New York City Category:United States Council of Economic Advisers
